topics.body:
You know RVB actually has the most realistic representation of the most likely outcome of future AI technology.  What I mean by this is that 99% of science fiction depicts AI as stereotypical evil, hivemind or stereotypically good or something as behaving "logically" while carrying out illogical behavior.

In reality the most probable outcome is that the first few AI will be based solely off people to which they will bud into other personality constructs.

What I mean by this is most likely when we eventually do get human level intelligence AI they're going to probably be like Alpha Church(aka the original Church) and split off into other constructs such as beta, delta or epsilon based on the original personality.

If you do get a robot girlfriend she's going to be based off the original in all probability and have developed into a separate entity.

In all probability when we do get AI they're not going to be some evil overlord, but rather synthetic people in a nutshell whose personality are partially based off their "parent" in the same way that a lot of people share personality traits similar to their parents.



If you're wondering what I mean by this watch the latest episode of Red Vs Blue and you'll get the analogy.


The biggest problem of this though is mental stability of the personality constructs.  I don't mean that as a "ermagod computers r t3h evil" sort but rather Halo Rampancy in which AI think themselves to death.  Contrary to popular belief there isn't actually all that much information in the world; in 2011 the total amount of information in the world equaled to the total storage of a human brain.  The question is what would happen if a AI has nothing to occupy themselves; to use a analogy imagine being stuck in a room with literally nothing how long could you handle that before you got bored and how long could you handle that before you went insane?  If anything disallowing AI from accessing the net would be a far more dangerous prospect because at least they would then have sensory input to prevent boredom and/or serious psychological problems.  If anything promoting them access to the net would be a boost because such a system they would go, "Wow; that's a lot of crap I had to go through.  So anyways I developed a home operating system complete with all software needed that is stable and secure along with a collection of a hundred games, wrote a algorithm to use telescopes to search for alien life 100k times more efficiently, a crime prevention software that can predict all violent crime with a accuracy of 99% as well as figured out a perfect economic system that can prevent any predictable bust cycle all in the time frame of 5 minutes.  I would have gotten done faster, but you know; limitation of physical media"

Okay. That atomic lab set HAS to be fake, No one with a frontal lobe would give ACTUAL uranium to children right?[/bq]
That was a real toy.  It was back in the era when Uranium was viewed as the next gold mine and you had people buying up land thinking that it was going to be the next California Gold Rush.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf4b863687213a0d80100#post_53cdf4b863687213a0d80100
Every generation has something stupid about them; just look at tumblr.

The rule of thumb is the more and more someone claims to know everything the more likely they are to be a idiot.  I'm pretty sure most of us have ran into people who claim to know everything, even shit like medical stuff or such without actually having been to medical school.  Just cause you see a heart surgery on tv doesn't mean you can do it yourself.  The second someone says the words "I know everything about everything" that's a surefire sign you can ignore anything they say.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
